title: Managing Nitrogen and water this summer crop planting season

tasks.task: Checking soil moisture and nitrogen levels in flooded paddocks before summer cropping.
subtasks: Using a soil corer or probe to check soil moisture levels.
Considering high clay soils' tendency to seal.
Monitoring potential denitrification caused by waterlogging.
Testing soil nitrate levels to avoid overapplying nitrogen fertilizer.
Assessing soil moisture depth to plan future crop needs.

tasks.task: Considering delayed nitrogen availability in flooded paddocks.
subtasks: Noting how denitrification may push nitrate further into the soil profile.
Recognizing that available nitrogen may not be immediately useful.
Planning nitrogen application timing based on crop growth stages.

tasks.task: Evaluating double cropping possibilities for mung beans.
subtasks: Considering current winter cereal crop health and moisture usage.
Weighing the risk of depleting soil moisture for summer crops.
Waiting until closer to the decision-making period (with a few months of growth remaining).

tasks.task: Informing oneself about paddock conditions before making cropping decisions.
subtasks: Assessing overall paddock suitability for summer crops.
Collecting data on soil moisture, nitrogen, and other factors.
Making informed decisions based on current paddock conditions.

tasks.task: Checking soil moisture and nitrogen levels in flooded paddocks before summer cropping.
Considering delayed nitrogen availability in flooded paddocks.
Evaluating double cropping possibilities for mung beans.
Informing oneself about paddock conditions before making cropping decisions.
